D0.Description: No government structure. In many cases, family bonds predominate.

D1.Description: Ruling functions are assumed by a company managerial elite, and most citizenry are company employees or depandants.
D1.Examples: Corporate outpost, asteroid mine, feudal domain.

D2.Description: Ruling functions are reached by the advice and consent of the citizenry directly.

D3.Description: Ruling functions are performed by a restricted minority, with little or no input from the mass of citizenry.

D4.Description: Ruling functions are performed by elected representatives.

D5.Description: Ruling functions are performaed by specific individuals for persons who agree to be rulled by them. Relationships are based on the performance of technical activities which are mutually beneficial.

D6.Description: Ruling functions are performed by an imposed leadership answerable to an outside group.

D7.Description: No central authority exists; rival governments compete for control. Law level referes to the government nearest to the starport.

D8.Description: Ruling functions are performed by govenrment agencies employing individuals selected for their expertise.

D9.Description: Ruling functions are performed by agencies which have become insulated from the goverened citizens.
D9.Examples: Entrenched castes or bureaucrats, decaying emperor

DA.Description: Ruling functions are performed by agencies directed by a single leader who enjoys the overwhelming confidence of the citizens.

DB.Description: A previous charismatic leader has been replaced by the normal chanels.

DC.Description: Ruling functions are performed by a select group of members of an organisation of class which enjoys an overwhelming confidence of the citizenry.

DD.Description: Ruling functions are performed by a religious organisation without regard to the specific individual needs of the citizenry.
DD.Examples: Cult, trancendant philosophy, psionic group mind.
